entries.title: How to Choose Between a Bank and a Credit Union
entries.description:
Even if you’ve seen a credit union in your town, you may not have given much thought to what they are exactly. Credit unions are financial institutions just like banks, but with a few key differences in how they operate. Here’s what to know about the main differences between credit unions and banks, and how you can…

Read more...

entries.title: All the New Electric Vehicles Eligible for the Clean Vehicle Tax Credit
entries.description:
If you’ve been eyeing the market for an electric vehicle, this year is as good a time as any. That’s because the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) is giving $7,500 tax credits for those who buy or lease new electric vehicles and a tax credit of up to $4,000 for used electric cars.

Read more...

entries.title: The 10 Best Sandbag Exercises to Try at the Gym (or at Home)
entries.description:
A sandbag may look like one of the most boring pieces of equipment in the gym, but I say it’s among the most underrated. That goes double for a home gym: Most people drop cash on dumbbells or barbells when a sandbag will give you way more weight for your money—and a good deal of versatility.

Read more...

entries.title: The Secret Way to Restart Your iPhone
entries.description:
When your iPhone is acting up, the best first step to try is a restart. A simple reboot often flushes away temporary bugs and glitches for all devices, and your iPhone is no exception. Unlike a computer, however, there is no restart option preset on your iPhone. Instead, you fully shut down your iPhone, then power it…

Read more...

entries.title: Google Chrome Is About to Be Problem on Your Parents’ PC
entries.description:
Many of our parents’ computers are essentially held up with duct tape. How these ancient behemoths manage to power on each day is an eternal mystery. But if your parents are running an old version of Windows, specifically Windows 7, 8, or 8.1, be warned: Google Chrome is about to get rocky.

Read more...

entries.title: How to Pick a Bagged Salad That Is Actually Good
entries.description:
It’s salad season. Not because of the produce currently available—though I love a winter salad—but because now is the time of resolutions, and meal planning, and “getting it together.” A lot of people associate those things with eating bowls—big metal bowls—of raw greens and other vegetables, and bagged salad kits are…

Read more...

entries.title: Burger King Wants to Give You Free Fries for Six Months
entries.description:
While you could learn how to make fast food-worthy fries at home, you might as well save yourself the trouble, because Burger King wants to give them to you for free for the next six months.

Read more...

entries.title: Make This Spinach and Artichoke Dip With Three Ingredients and a Microwave
entries.description:
We have no shortage of love for spinach and artichoke dip (including how to improve your usual recipes), and it’s no wonder–the stuff is incredible. It’s creamy, salty, tangy, and “spinach” is the first word, which makes it sound “healthy”. No version of spinach dip is a bad idea, but there is an easiest, quickest,…

Read more...

entries.title: What the ‘Mediterranean Diet’ Is, and How to Actually Follow It
entries.description:
The Mediterranean diet has made the bullshit list of “best diets” once again, which got me thinking: has anybody ever gone on the Mediterranean diet? Like on purpose? There’s no straightforward app to track it, and no easy-to-read book that gives simplistic rules to say yes or no to a given meal.

Read more...

entries.title: How to Take a Hot Shower If Your Water Heater’s Busted
entries.description:
Too often we take the gift of a hot shower for granted. When a flood ripped through my house a few years ago and trashed the water heater, I took my first ice-cold shower ever, and vowed to never repeat a truly miserable experience.

Read more...

entries.title: Why You Might Lose Medicaid Coverage in 2023
entries.description:
During the pandemic, Congress effectively prevented states from kicking people off Medicaid, the nation’s public health insurance program for people with low income. This led to a historic number of enrollments over the past two years. But now, the passing of Congress’ $1.7 trillion omnibus package means millions who…

Read more...

entries.title: TikTok Is Wrong About Boiling Air Freshener Wicks
entries.description:
There’s a new hack floating around TikTok that suggests your wick-based air fresheners, like the kind you plug into the wall, don’t have to be tossed out when they stop working. Instead, according to some social media posts, you can boil the wicks to give your home a major scent boost. Seems like a neat way to indulge…

Read more...

entries.title: You Can Actually Grow Weed As a Houseplant
entries.description:
As cannabis continues to emerge from the haze of prohibition, you can expect to start seeing it just about everywhere—provided you live in a state where it is legal for recreational use, that is. One place it has always belonged, but not often occupied for various reasons (from the threat of law enforcement, to theft,…

Read more...

entries.title: Every Game Coming to PlayStation Plus and Xbox Game Pass in January 2023 (So Far)
entries.description:
Happy new year! I hope you got a chance to catch up on your gaming backlog over the holidays, because 2023 is starting off strong with a litany of great games coming to PlayStation Plus and Xbox Game Pass in this month, including freebies you can download and keep forever, and limited-time additions to each service’s…

Read more...

entries.title: All the New Federal and State Laws You Should Know About in 2023
entries.description:
Despite appearances, the United States is still a nation of laws, and every January first, we wake up to a gaggle of new ones that were passed by our hard-working legislators over the previous year. 2023 promises many new and exciting rules that must be followed or you’ll thrown into a cage, so here’s a cross-country…

Read more...

entries.title: When to Use Chocolate Chips, Chunks, and Shavings
entries.description:
I’m just now coming down from my annual four-week holiday cookie baking bender, and I’ve had time to ponder some of the ways my baking was affected by various types and forms of chocolate. It’s a versatile ingredient to a point, but some chocolate shapes are better suited to certain things. Before you grab a bag of…

Read more...

entries.title: 11 Ways to Actually Eat Healthier in the New Year
entries.description:
If your resolution is to eat healthy in the new year, please don’t hop into any crash diets or misguided detoxes. Here are some of our best tips, articles, and in-depth guides about how to eat healthy in a way that’s actually good for your body and mind.

Read more...

entries.title: This Is Your New Favorite Way to Eat Tinned Fish
entries.description:
It was New Year’s Eve afternoon, and I was limping around the local bougie grocery store in a protective boot, desperately searching for caviar with which to make my favorite fancy girl snack of caviar and chips. All they had was salmon roe, my least favorite roe. (It’s too much like a fish Gusher! Sorry!) “Of…

Read more...
